meanings.definition: To give a tangible or visible form to something.
meanings.sent1: She was imbodying her ideas into beautiful paintings.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor was imbodying his vision into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The magician imbodying a rabbit out of thin air amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter imbodying joy and happiness filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun imbodying warmth on a cold day was a welcome sight.

meanings.sent1: The hero in the story was imbodying courage and bravery.
meanings.sent2: The statue imbodying peace stood tall in the park.
meanings.sent3: The cat imbodying laziness slept all day on the couch.
meanings.sent4: His actions imbodying kindness touched everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The old tree imbodying wisdom seemed to whisper ancient secrets.
